Description: Small marl pottery vase with globular body, two short pierced lug-handles at shoulder, and everted ledge-rim. The exterior is decorated in red-brown paint with parallel wavy-lines running diagonally around the upper body, two horizontal wavy lines at the maximum diameter and vertical wavy lines around the lower body, bisected on the base by a perpendicular band of three wavy lines. There is a wavy line painted on the rim top.
Curator's comments: Closest parallel is in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery D9H series.
Condition: fair (exterior worn and rim chipped). Rim chapped, paint slightly worn.
